Don't you all see the technique behind his answers? 
1. He NEVER answers a question with a direct answer. This is why he needs a lot of words and time to make his point.
2. Every accusation (against himself) is an opportunity to reflect similar accusations - against other countries (U.S.) or institutions (NATO), which draws attention away from the original confrontation.
3. When the journalist tries to re-center the questions as VP is not answering, the journalist is dismissed with an idiom like: "Don’t blame a mirror (VP) for your ugly face (U.S.)" or "you interrupt me because you don't like my answer". He is mastering every kind of re-approach.
4. He does not obviously lie, but won't tell the truth either. He thinks bad of Biden, but doesn't state it, instead he talks good of Trump.
5. He asks for proof but won't give proof himself, just clever phrases.
6. He stays calm and polite, even admits he doesn't know certain things or doesn't remember certain events. This gives the impression of honesty and credibilty but in fact this might also be utilzed as an "answering tactic".
7. Questions that no one EVER would answer with "yes" (e.g. the killer question) make him laugh. But that is no wonder, indeed, a very poorly worded question.

Unfortunately, the journalist doesn't master the skills of VP's interviewing technique. This gives VP the opportunity to present himself in the best light. VP is highly intelligent and charming, but manipulative, and this is what makes him so dangerous and unpredictable. Don't fall for it.
